title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Latin America and Caribbean Water and Wastewater Virtual RTM Series, through Futron Corporation

description.narrative: The Latin America and Caribbean Water and Wastewater Virtual RTM Series focuses on U.S. technologies and best practices in the water and wastewater sector that support priority water and wastewater infrastructure development projects in Brazil, Ecuador, Jamaica, and Mexico. This RTM Series supports USTDAs Global Partnership for Climate-Smart Infrastructure by leveraging U.S. industry to help deliver energy efficiency and energy saving solutions.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

description.narrative: The Regional Latin America and the Caribbean (LAC) Rail Infrastructure Modernization Reverse Trade Mission brings delegates to the United States to familiarize key government and private sector representatives from LAC countries with best practices, regulatory advances, and technologies to support overall efficiency, emissions reductions, digitization, as well as resiliency and safety in rail infrastructure projects across the region.

title.narrative: Definitional Mission - Aviation Sector, through Montgomery Consulting Group, Inc.

description.narrative: This $75,000 definitional mission is identifying and evaluating opportunities in the aviation sector in Colombia, the Dominican Republic, and Jamaica for USTDA funding consideration. The aviation sector is one of the most dynamic sectors of infrastructure growth in the Latin America and the Caribbean region.

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Cybersecurity and Access Control for Utilities, through Koeppen, Elliot & Associates, Ltd.

description.narrative: The Cybersecurity and Access Control for Utilities Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) series is comprised of three separate RTMs for up to twelve high-level delegates per visit from (i) Colombia, the Dominican Republic, and Peru; (ii) Mexico and Panama; and (iii) Brazil. The visits will familiarize delegates with U.S. access control and cybersecurity guidelines and technologies applicable to gas, electricity, and water utilities as well as national oil companies. The first visit took place in November 2014. Delegates representing the public and private sector utility entities, system operators, and oil companies from Panama, Brazil, and Mexico will visit Washington, DC, Silicon Valley, CA, and one other city during each of the other two visits.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

description.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Financial Sector IT Security Modernization, through Technical Resources International, Inc.

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Flight Safety Standards, through Koeppen, Elliot & Associates, Ltd.

description.narrative: The Flight Safety Standards in the Latin America and Caribbean Region Reverse Trade Mission was designed to promote civil aviation safety oversight in Brazil and Mexico.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Financial Sector IT Security Modernization, through Technical Resources International, Inc.

description.narrative: This series of two reverse trade missions (RTMs) familiarized Brazilian and Colombian financial sector representatives with U.S. technologies and solutions for the banking sector, particularly relating to mobile and internet banking, anti-money laundering solutions, fraud analytics, and customer relationship management solutions. Each RTM assisted these countries' efforts to modernize their financial sectors and broaden citizens' access to financial services.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Green Port Technologies, through Meridian International Center

description.narrative: The Green Port Technologies Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) series will consist of three separate RTMs for delegates from public and private sector transportation entities from (i) Brazil; (ii) Colombia and the Dominican Republic; and (iii) Mexico and Panama. The objective of the three separate Green Port Technologies RTMs is to introduce delegates to U.S. technologies designed to reduce harmful emissions and improve energy efficiency in ports, inland waterways, and maritime transportation networks.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Renewable Energy Grid Integration, through Maritz, LLC

description.narrative: The Renewable Energy Grid Integration Reverse Trade Mission familiarized ministerial and senior-level Latin American public sector representatives with the U.S. regulatory framework and technology associated with the integration of renewable energy resources into the electric grid. The Reverse Trade Mission included visits to Washington, DC, Golden, CO, and Austin, TX. The delegation also visited the National Renewable Energy Laboratory.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Energy generation, renewable sources - multiple technologies

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - CLEAN ENERGY EXCHANGE PROGRAM FOR THE AMERICAS, through Koeppen, Elliot & Associates, Ltd.

description.narrative: This $850,000 Clean Energy Exchange Program for the Americas orientation visit familiarizes Latin American and Caribbean energy sector officials and renewable energy project sponsors with U.S. clean energy technologies through a two-year-long series of orientation visits. The exchange program complements and directly supports the Energy and Climate Partnership of the Americas and the U.S.-Mexico Bilateral Framework on Clean Energy and Climate Change that were announced by President Obama in April 2009.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - AVIATION COOPERATION INITIATIVE OF THE AMERICAS, through American Association of Airport Executives

description.narrative: This $935,000 Aviation Cooperation Initiative of the Americas familiarizes Latin American and Caribbean aviation sector officials and project sponsors with U.S. aviation technologies through a program of three orientation visits, each of which contains a specialized workshop or business briefing.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - CARRIBEAN AIRPORT CERTIFICATION PROCESS, through Government - Country unknown

description.narrative: USTDA is providing a $207,000 technical assistance grant to the Carribbean Aviation Safety and Security Oversight System (CASSOS) to assist selected member countries with their airport certification process.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - EARTHQUAKE MONITORING TECHNOLOGIES INITIATIVE, through Koeppen, Elliot & Associates, Ltd.

description.narrative: This $622,000 orientation visit initiative is designed to expose key Latin America and Caribbean officials to the latest U.S. technologies and best practices with respect to earthquake monitoring and communication systems. As illustrated by recent earthquakes in Chile and Haiti, the impact of such natural disasters can be tremendous and the modest investment in earthquake monitoring and communcations technologies could help to save hundreds, if not thousands, of lives, while at the same time generating new opportunities for the sale of U.S. goods and services.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - Colombia and Haiti Port Security Technologies and VTM Information Systems, through Meridian International Center

description.narrative: This $342,128 Colombia and Haiti Port Security Technologies and VTM Information Systems Reverse Trade Mission brings officials from Colombia and Haiti to the U.S. to familiarize them with the latest available VTMIS and port security system technologies. The visits include meetings with U.S. suppliers as well as site visits to U.S. ports with important VTMIS and port security operations.

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - LAC Intelligent Transportation Systems Initiative RTM, through Koeppen, Elliot & Associates, Ltd.

description.narrative: This $598,000 Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) Initiative for Latin America and the Caribbean brings officials from Brazil, Colombia, and Mexico to the U.S. through 3 separate visits to meet with U.S. public and private sector officials with expertise in ITS. For these 3 most populous countries in Latin America, the reverse trade missions provide opportunitites to learn about suitable ITS technologies that will assist them with improving traffic management, highway decongestion, and motorist safety.

title.narrative: Technical Symposium - Latin America and Caribbean Airport Resiliency, through American Association of Airport Executives
